document.heading: Bank Charter Modernization Amendment Act of 2007

history.narrative: Law 17-59, the “Bank Charter Modernization Amendment Act of 2007”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-166 which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Consumer Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 10, 2007, and October 2, 2007, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 17, 2007, it was assigned Act No. 17-133 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-59 became effective on December 11, 2007.
